Curriculum                                                                                          The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                       Leadership and Human Capital Management                                                                                           About             Director's Message Faculty News                   Admissions                 Academics             Graduate Programs Noncredit Offerings                   Career                 Events                 Alumni                                                   Curriculum                                            Graduate Programs ›                M.S. in Human Resource Management and Development                  Curriculum          Opportunities and Outcomes          Faculty          Admissions Process                   Graduate Certificate in Benefits and Compensation            Graduate Certificate in Human Resource Management            Graduate Certificate in Organizational and Executive Coaching                               Ready to Proceed?           Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                              Taught by leading practitioner-scholars in the HR industry, our curriculum is offered on-site and online, and equips you to become a strategic business professional with specialized expertise in effectively leading and managing people in today’s global organizations. It explores the principles of people and organizational strategy in a global economy, introduces you to data analytics and quantitative modeling as a means of decisionmaking, and delves into business strategy and ethics. It addresses the latest trends as well as external forces that impact how individuals engage in work now and in the future. The program allows you to develop a specialized orientation grounded in pedagogy and innovative practice in one of four areas: human resource management, organizational effectiveness and leadership, global talent, and learning and development.   The 42-credit M.S. in Human Resource Management and Development can be completed in two years of full-time study, or in up to five years of part-time study. Whether you are already a professional in the field, or you are just beginning your career, the program’s conveniently scheduled courses are tailored to fit your busy lifestyle. Classes are offered on a flexible schedule, and you have the option of taking them online or on-site, during the evening or day, or during the weekend.     Composed of core courses, a concentration, electives, and a capstone project, the curriculum is continually reevaluated and updated in response to industry needs and to provide you with the most up-to-date and relevant course of study.             Expand All   Collapse All          Core Curriculum        The core curriculum is designed to provide you with a deep and broad foundation that supports concentration coursework and serves you throughout your career. Students are required to take all of the following courses.
